events.title: Spotlight on Val Fagan
events.description: Spotlight on Val Fagan  will be a fun evening of song and conversation. Val, star of many Chestnut productions, is a Broadway veteran and lifelong theatre artist. The show will feature Broadway favorites and songs of the 60s & 70s. She will share her interesting story through the songs of Karen Carpenter, Joni Mitchell, Patsy Cline, Carole King, Burt Bacharach and many others. Val will sing, play guitar, drums, banjo, mandolin, ukulele and tell a few Minnie Pearl jokes. It's sure to be a fun evening!

events.title: Dickens Carolers in Concert
events.description: The Dickens Carolers, Kansas City's premiere professional Christmas carolers, will present four holiday concerts at the Chestnut Fine Arts Center. The voices of the Dickens Carolers have been compared to those of heavenly angels! Treat yourself to a special holiday gift as you relax and listen to your favorites holiday melodies sung by the Dickens Carolers in Concert. (Rated G)

events.title: Mother's Daughter
events.description: This stunning third part to Kate Hennig’s powerful Queenmaker Series, England’s first queen finds herself fighting xenophobia, religious nationalism, and strained familial bonds in the power struggle that dubs her Bloody Mary. Upon the death of King Edward VI, the thirty-eight-year-old princess Mary—daughter of Henry VIII —wrests the throne from Edward’s deemed heir, Lady Jane. Relentless even in death, Mary’s mother appears in memory and adamantly questions the motives of Mary’s cousin Jane and her half-sister Bess, despite Mary’s affection for them both. As England splits along Roman Catholic and Protestant lines, Mary balances the razor’s edge of ethics and politics to hold onto her own sanity. Should she execute her opponents before it’s too late, the way her father did? Should she scramble to find a husband who can give her a rightful heir? Who can be trusted? Her mother, her sister, or even herself?

events.title: A Man for All Seasons
events.description: It’s not easy telling truth to power, even in the 1500’s. It’s not easy telling truth to power, even in the 1500’s. A Man for All Seasons is the story of Sir Thomas More, an English statesman, lawyer, and Lord High Chancellor of England under King Henry VIII. Once the King’s beloved teacher, More’s relationship to the King fractures when he refuses to take the Oath of Supremacy swearing allegiance to the monarchy as the head of the Church of England and legitimizing the annulment of Henry’s marriage to Catherine of Aragon. Guided by the Common Man (who also plays a number of ensemble parts), the play follows More as he is confronted by his beloved family, who contrast starkly with powerful Cardinal Wolsey and the opportunistic Richard Rich. Young King Henry VIII, drunk on power and wine, burdened by sin, and determined to secure an heir to the throne, demands More’s help. More’s beloved family want him home and safe. Chockful of moments of rich humor and transparent theatricality in modern style, More navigates his way through the maze of Henry’s marriages, potential martyrdom, and the north star of his own morality.

events.title: Silent Sky
events.description: Silent Sky tells the true story of Henrietta Leavitt, an astronomer ahead of her time. It is 1900, and Henrietta has the opportunity to work at Harvard University as a human computer, one of Dr. Edward Pickering’s “harem,” mapping the stars but receiving no scientific credit. Eager to use Harvard’s telescope—the Great Refractor—Harriet is told that she will not be able to do any sort of astronomical discovery. She will only log the stars photographed by the men of the department. Undeterred, Henrietta begins the process of recording the changes in Cepheid stars - a scientific discovery that has profound and lasting impact on the field of astronomy. Committed to her inquiry, the strain tilts the orbits of her other relationships: her sister Margaret, her love interest Peter Shaw, and her colleagues Annie Cannon and Willamina Fleming– which flicker in favor of a great cosmic mystery.  Silent Sky is the true, beautiful tale of a woman’s dedication to her passion for the stars, of the song that is life and space and the human touch that makes life under the vast sky tender, beautiful and timeless.

It is 1900, and Henrietta has the opportunity to work at Harvard University as a human computer, one of Dr. Edward Pickering’s “harem,” mapping the stars but receiving no scientific credit. Eager to use Harvard’s telescope—the Great Refractor—Harriet is told that she will not be able to do any sort of astronomical discovery. She will only log the stars photographed by the men of the department. Undeterred, Henrietta begins the process of recording the changes in Cepheid stars - a scientific discovery that has profound and lasting impact on the field of astronomy. Committed to her inquiry, the strain tilts the orbits of her other relationships: her sister Margaret, her love interest Peter Shaw, and her colleagues Annie Cannon and Willamina Fleming– which flicker in favor of a great cosmic mystery.  Silent Sky is the true, beautiful tale of a woman’s dedication to her passion for the stars, of the song that is life and space and the human touch that makes life under the vast sky tender, beautiful and timeless.

events.title: The Shawshank Redemption
events.description: Based on the novella by Stephen King, The Shawshank Redemption follows the story of Andy Dufresne, a successful banker sentenced to two consecutive life terms at Shawshank State Penitentiary for the murders of his wife and her lover, a crime he maintains he did not commit. Inside the grim walls of Shawshank, Andy meets Ellis Boyd “Red” Redding, a lifer who becomes his close friend. Through the years, Andy faces the harsh realities of prison life, including the corruption of the prison warden and guards, but never loses hope. Andy puts his banking skills to use, gains the trust of the warden and prison staff implementing their financial scams.  His hope and determination and connection to Red get him through. One of the best breakout stories of all time, the play brings the glorious story of resilience and friendship made famous by the acclaimed film to the stage.  See Shawshank Live on Stage!

events.title: American Holiday Stories
events.description:
A performance of two Great American Christmas classics - Act 1: In one continuous scene, Thornton Wilder chronicles six generations of a pioneering and enterprising American dynasty into a seamless series of family Christmas gatherings in The Long Christmas Dinner. Wilder compresses time by moving characters onstage through generations of adolescence, marriage, parenthood, and maturity. Like his later masterpiece, Our Town, Wilder's play captures and celebrates the sweet and poignant transitory joys of family life.
Act 2: In A Christmas Memory, Truman Capote recalls an idyllic Southern holiday season when as a young boy he baked fruitcakes, gathered holly, and flew kites with the beloved eccentric cousin who raised him and inspired him to become a writer. It is a beloved celebration of fruitcake, love, family, friendship, and Christmas. Join us for Holiday cheer and celebration after every performance!

events.title: Cats
events.description: MTH’s critically-acclaimed, record setting production returns. One of the worlds best loved and most iconic musicals, Andrew Lloyd Webber’s Tony Award-winner is one of the longest-running Broadway musicals of all time. Known for its spectacular music and innovative storytelling, the MTH production features explosive hip-hop and street jazz choreography to tell the tale. Set amongst a larger-than-life junkyard playground, MTH sold out every performance of its original run in 2018.

events.title: Rent
events.description: Jonathan Larson's iconic, Tony Award winning musical shaped a generation and taught us to measure our lives in love. A show about connection and healing, RENT is one of only ten musicals ever to be awarded the Pulitzer Prize for drama. Loosely based on Puccini's La Boheme, the infectious pop-rock score has become a pop cultural phenomenon, with songs and stories that resonate with audiences of all ages.

events.title: A Ruby Room Christmas
events.description: An all new, original holiday concert designed to illicit all the holiday feels for you and your family. Embracing the sleek yet cozy aesthetic of the evocative Ruby Room, this musical holiday concert is sure to leave a smile on your face and a warmth in your heart as we feature glorious holiday arrangements of Christmas classics, as well as contemporary holiday tunes, as well. There may or may not be a hot chocolate bar, as well.

Embracing the sleek yet cozy aesthetic of the evocative Ruby Room, this musical holiday concert is sure to leave a smile on your face and a warmth in your heart as we feature glorious holiday arrangements of Christmas classics, as well as contemporary holiday tunes, as well. There may or may not be a hot chocolate bar, as well.

events.title: On the Road Again:  The Music of Willie, Waylan, & Johnny Cash
events.description: Hit the highway and experience the music of country legends Willie Nelson, Waylon Jennings, and Johnny Cash. With a tribute to their timeless hits like “On The Road Again,” “Mama Tried,” and “Folsom Prison Blues,” this concert captures the spirit of outlaw country and the unforgettable voices that defined a genre. Filled with soulfulballads, foot-stomping anthems, and legendary tunes, we’ll take you on a musical journey through the heart of country music.

events.title: STOP! In the Name of Love:  The Music of Diana Ross & The Supremes
events.description: Get ready to groove to the legendary sounds of Diana Ross & The Supremes in a concert celebrating the iconic hits of Motown’s most beloved girl group. From “Baby Love” to “You Can’t Hurry Love” and, of course, “Stop! In the Name of Love,” this show brings the glamour, power, and passion of The Supremes to life. This musical journey to a soul-filled and unforgettable era is one you won’t want to miss.

events.title: Let It Be: The Music of The Beatles
events.description: With classic like “Hey Jude,” “Yesterday,” and “Come Together,” this unforgettable concert brings the legendary music of John, Paul, George, and Ringo to life with captivating performances as we journey through their greatest tunes. Whether you’re a lifelong fan or discovering their music for the first time, this show immerses audiences in the music that changed the world, oﬀering a fresh yet nostalgic experience of the Fab Four’s legendary sound.

events.title: Take It Easy: The Music of The Eagles & Fleetwood Mac
events.description: Step into a night of timeless rock as we celebrate the legendary music of The Eagles and Fleetwood Mac. This electrifying tribute concert brings two of the most iconic bands in music history to life in our unforgettable Ruby Room. With soaring harmonies and classic melodies, this show captures the spirit, sound, and soul of the ‘70s rock revolution. Get ready to sing along, reminisce, and immerse yourself in the sounds that left a lasting mark on music history.

With soaring harmonies and classic melodies, this show captures the spirit, sound, and soul of the ‘70s rock revolution. Get ready to sing along, reminisce, and immerse yourself in the sounds that left a lasting mark on music history.

events.title: Aretha: The Music of Aretha Franklin
events.description: Feel the power of the Queen of Soul in a thrilling concert celebrating the iconic music of Aretha Franklin. From the soulful anthem “Respect” to the timeless ballad “I Say a Little Prayer,” this show brings Aretha’s unforgettable hits to life with powerhouse vocals and a tribute to her unmatched legacy. With each note, ARETHA delivers a soulful, electrifying journey through the songs that defined a legend and continue to inspire generations.

events.title: Free Fallin’: The Music of Tom Petty & Bob Dylan
events.description: Take a walk straight to the heart of American rock and folk as we celebrate the legendary music of Tom Petty and Bob Dylan. From Petty’s iconic hits “Free Fallin’” and “Learning to Fly” to Dylan’s timeless classics “Blowin’ in the Wind” and “The Times They Are A-Changin’,” we’ll showcase the music that shaped rock and folk history, through rich melodies and poetic lyrics, filled with stories of love, change, and rebellion that continue to resonate across generations.

events.title: The Wild Party
events.description: “Based on Joseph Moncure March’s 1928 narrative poem of the same name, this darkly brilliant show features one of the most exciting, pulse-racing scores ever written. Lovers Queenie and Burrs decide to throw the party-to-end-all-parties in their Manhattan apartment. After the colorful arrival of a slew of guests living life on the edge, Queenie’s wandering eyes land on a striking man named Black. As the decadence is reaching a climax, so is Burrs’ jealousy, which erupts and sends him into a violent rage. Gun in hand and inhibitions abandoned, Burrs turns on Queenie and Black. The gun gets fired, but who’s been shot?” (Music Theatre International)

events.title: Suite Surrender
events.description: “It’s 1942, and two of Hollywood’s biggest divas have descended upon the luxurious Palm Beach Royale Hotel — assistants, luggage, and legendary feud with one another in tow. Everything seems to be in order for their wartime performance…that is, until they are somehow assigned to the same suite. Mistaken identities, overblown egos, double entendres, and a lap dog named Mr. Boodles round out this hilarious riot of a love note to the classic farces of the 30s and 40s.” (Playscripts)

events.title: The Father
events.description: Now 80 years old, André was once a tap dancer. He lives with his daughter, Anne, and her husband, Antoine. Or was André an engineer, whose daughter Anne lives in London with her new lover, Pierre? The thing is, he is still wearing his pyjamas, and he can’t find his watch. He is starting to wonder if he’s losing control.” (Dramatists Play Service)
